intro: Hibbertia recurvifolia var. virens, commonly known as the green-flowered hibbertia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Dilleniaceae and is characterized by its slender, ascending stems and small, ovate leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers with prominent stamens, which are often surrounded by greenish bracts. It thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is typically found in coastal or heathland environments. Hibbertia recurvifolia var. virens is a relatively rare variant, often growing in specific microhabitats within its native range.
